SEARCH
Package civitas.celestis.math.vector

Interface DoubleVector<V extends DoubleVector<V>>

Type Parameters:
V - The vector itself (the result and parameter of various operations)
All Superinterfaces:
Collectable<Double>, Groupable<Double>, Listable<Double>, Serializable, Transformable<Double>, Vector<Double,V>
All Known Implementing Classes:
ArrayVector, Quaternion, Vector2, Vector3, Vector4
public interface DoubleVector<V extends DoubleVector<V>> extends Vector<Double,V>
A mathematical vector which uses the primitive numerical type double.

  • Method Details

    • array

      @Nonnull double[] array()
      Converts this vector into an array of doubles.
      Returns:
      The array representation of this vector

    • isNaN

      boolean isNaN()
      Checks if this vector contains not-a-number values.
      Returns:
      true if at least one of the components are not a number
      See Also:
      • Double.isNaN(double)

    • isFinite

      boolean isFinite()
      Checks if this vector is finite.
      Returns:
      true if every component of this vector is of a finite value
      See Also:
      • Double.isFinite(double)

    • isInfinite

      boolean isInfinite()
      Checks if this vector is infinite.
      Returns:
      true if at least one component of this vector has an infinite magnitude
      See Also:
      • Double.isInfinite(double)

    • norm

      double norm()
      Returns the Euclidean norm of this vector. Note that this operation involves taking the square root of this vector's components. Using norm2() is recommended for simple comparison between magnitudes.
      Returns:
      The Euclidean norm of this vector
      See Also:
      • norm2()

    • norm2

      double norm2()
      Returns the squared Euclidean norm of this vector. The squared norm is useful as it does not involve a square root operation.
      Returns:
      The squared Euclidean norm of this vector

    • normManhattan

      double normManhattan()
      Returns the Manhattan norm of this vector. This is achieved by summing the absolute values of every component of this vector.
      Returns:
      The Manhattan norm of this vector

    • requireNaN

      @Nonnull default V requireNaN() throws IllegalStateException
      Requires that this vector is not a number. If this vector is not a number, this will simply return a reference to itself. If not, this will throw an IllegalStateException.
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - When this vector is not NaN (not-a-number)

    • requireFinite

      @Nonnull default V requireFinite() throws IllegalStateException
      Requires that this vector is finite. If this vector is finite, this will simply return a reference to itself. If not, this will throw an IllegalStateException.
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - When this vector is non-finite (NaN or infinity)

    • requireInfinite

      @Nonnull default V requireInfinite() throws IllegalStateException
      Requires that this vector is infinite. If this vector is infinite, this will simply return a reference to itself. If not, this will throw an IllegalStateException.
      Returns:
      this
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - When this vector is not infinite

      double dot(@Nonnull V v)
      Returns the dot product between this vector and the provided vector v.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      The dot product of the two vectors

    • distance

      double distance(@Nonnull V v)
      Returns the Euclidean distance between this vector and the provided vector v. Note that this operation involves square roots, and using distance2(DoubleVector) is recommended for simple comparisons.
      Parameters:
      v - The vector of which to get the Euclidean distance to
      Returns:
      The Euclidean distance between the two vectors

    • distance2

      double distance2(@Nonnull V v)
      Returns the squared Euclidean distance between this vector and the provided vector v.
      Parameters:
      v - The vector of which to get the squared Euclidean distance to
      Returns:
      The squared Euclidean distance between the two vectors
